column4: Okay, I have an Atheros card.  7.04 detects it and I'm able to configure it, but no matter what settings I put in - even when the key and password, excryption type, etc are all correct - it fails to connect.  I'm wondering if my router is the issue...are there any known issues with the DGL-4300 GamerLounge routers?
I have static IPs set and DHCP already turned off, plus ports forwarded to set IPs for every PC in the house, so yes.
using network-manager ?
Yes.
when it fails ?
and where you put the settings ?
you using wep or wpa ?
does it work with encryprions disabled ?
hmm i had a propblem like this with some ap - but it was temporary
look at 'dmesg'
open terminal and write "dmesg"
Iran dmesg.  What exactly am I looking for now?
this doesn't matter, are you sure the keys are correct ?  it's wierd that it doesnt connect
the router is currently setup for open connections - there is no key at the moment.
did it work before in ubuntu ?
7.04 is the first build I've tried since buying this wrieless router
ah, you can look in the routers admin panel and search for some logs
you can paste the last couple of lines maybe they will give a hint whats going on
[INFO]  Thu Apr 12 15:34:06 2007 Wireless system with MAC address 0015E92C4654 disconnected for reason: Received Deauthentication.
turn on dhcp on the router
do you have mac filtering or any other thing on ?
it looks like your using an ip that is not valid for the wifi
I have the same static IP address set in the Ubuntu network manager as I have set in Windows.  Windows connects fine.
its the ip  169.254.5.40 ? and the netmask etc is correctly configured ?
